author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Thursday announced a financial assistance of Rs. 5 lakh to each of the 44 fishermen from the State who were recently released from Iran prisons.

The fishermen from Ramanathapuram, Thoothukudi and Kanyakumari districts, working for a private fishing company in United Arab Emirates as contract labourers were arrested by Iran Coast Guard on December 1 last year on charges of illegal fishing in the Iranian waters.

Recalling her government's efforts in coordinating with officials of the Ministry of External Affairs in Delhi and those in Iran and UAE, Ms. Jayalalithaa in a statement said, “As a result of the continuous efforts taken by the Tamil Nadu government, all the 44 fishermen have been released.”

All the fishermen arrived in Tamil Nadu on March 3 and have been sent to their native towns on government expense, she said.

“Considering the poor financial conditions of the families of these 44 fishermen, I have ordered to grant a financial assistance of Rs. 5 lakh to each of the fishermen be granted from Chief Minister’s Public Relief Fund.

The assistance would help these fishermen in starting a new life,” she added.
title: Rs. 5 lakh assistance for fishermen released by Iran
